attrs.script:
# Set creds and headers
era_user = '@@{CRED_ERA.username}@@'
era_pass = '@@{CRED_ERA.secret}@@'
era_ip = '@@{ERA_IP}@@'
era_cluster = '@@{ERA_CLUSTER_NAME}@@'

# ========= DO NOT CHANGE AFTER HERE ==========
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}

# Get Cluster ID
url = "https://{}/era/v0.9/clusters/name/{}".format(era_ip,era_cluster)

resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers)
if resp.ok:
  print("CLUSTER_ID={}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['id']))
else:
  print("Get Cluster ID request failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
  exit(1)

# Set creds and headers
era_user = '@@{CRED_ERA.username}@@'
era_pass = '@@{CRED_ERA.secret}@@'
era_ip = '@@{ERA_IP}@@'
era_software_profile = '@@{ERA_SOFTWARE_PROFILE}@@'
era_compute_profile = '@@{ERA_COMPUTE_PROFILE}@@'
era_network_profile ='@@{ERA_NETWORK_PROFILE}@@'
era_database_parameter = '@@{ERA_DATABASE_PARAMETER}@@'
timestamp = '@@{calm_time("%Y%m%d%H%M")}@@'

# ========= DO NOT CHANGE AFTER HERE ==========
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}

# Get Software Profile ID
url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/profiles?type=Software&name={}".format(era_ip,era_software_profile)
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers)
if resp.ok:
  print("SOFTWARE_PROF_ID={}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['id']))
else:
  print("Get Software Profile ID request failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
  exit(1)
  
# Get Software Profile Version ID
url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/profiles?type=Software&name={}".format(era_ip,era_software_profile)
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers)
if resp.ok:
  print("SOFTWARE_PROF_VER_ID={}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['latestVersionId']))
else:
  print("Get Software Profile Version ID request failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
  exit(1)

# Get Compute Profile ID
url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/profiles?type=Compute&name={}".format(era_ip,era_compute_profile)
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers)
if resp.ok:
  print("COMPUTE_PROF_ID={}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['id']))
else:
  print("Get Compute Profile ID request failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
  exit(1)

# Get Network Profile ID
url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/profiles?type=Network&name={}".format(era_ip,era_network_profile)
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers)
if resp.ok:
  print("NETWORK_PROF_ID={}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['id']))
else:
  print("Get Network Profile ID request failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
  exit(1)

# Get DB Parameter ID
url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/profiles?type=Database_Parameter&name={}".format(era_ip,era_database_parameter)
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers)
if resp.ok:
  print("DB_PARAM_ID={}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['id']))
else:
  print("Get DB Parameter ID request failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
  exit(1)

# Set the timestamp to be used throughout the rest of the blueprint
print("TIMESTAMP={}".format(timestamp))

attrs.script:
# Set creds and headers
era_user = '@@{CRED_ERA.username}@@'
era_pass = '@@{CRED_ERA.secret}@@'
era_ip = '@@{ERA_IP}@@'
era_sla_name = '@@{ERA_SLA_NAME}@@'
timestamp = '@@{TIMESTAMP}@@'
db_name_prefix = '@@{DB_NAME_PREFIX}@@'

# ========= DO NOT CHANGE AFTER HERE ==========
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}

# Set the db_name here, so we don't have the calm_time macro expanding at two different times
print("DB_NAME={}_{}".format(db_name_prefix,timestamp))

# Get the list of SLAs
url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/slas".format(era_ip)
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers)

# Find the desired SLA, and set the corresponding ID to the variable
if resp.ok:
  for sla in json.loads(resp.content):
    if sla['name'] == era_sla_name:
      print("SLA_ID={}".format(sla['id']))
else:
  print("Get SLA request failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
  exit(1)

# Set creds and headers
era_user = '@@{CRED_ERA.username}@@'
era_pass = '@@{CRED_ERA.secret}@@'
era_ip = '@@{ERA_IP}@@'
create_operation_id = '@@{CREATE_OPERATION_ID}@@'

# ========= DO NOT CHANGE AFTER HERE ==========
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}


url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/operations/{}".format(era_ip,create_operation_id)

# Monitor the operation
for x in range(20):
  
  print("Sleeping for 60 seconds.")
  sleep(60)
  resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers)
  print("Percentage Complete: {}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['percentageComplete']))
  
  # If complete, break out of loop
  if json.loads(resp.content)['percentageComplete'] == "100":
    break

# If the operation did not complete within 20 minutes, assume it's not successful and error out
if json.loads(resp.content)['percentageComplete'] != "100":
  print("Get Operation ID timed out", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
  exit(1)

# Get the newly provision DB Entity Name and set it to a variable
print("DB_ENTITY_NAME={}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['entityName']))

# Set creds and headers
era_user = '@@{CRED_ERA.username}@@'
era_pass = '@@{CRED_ERA.secret}@@'
era_ip = '@@{ERA_IP}@@'
db_entity_name = '@@{DB_ENTITY_NAME}@@'

# ========= DO NOT CHANGE AFTER HERE ==========
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}

# Get DB Server IP and ID
url = "https://{}/era/v0.9/databases/{}?value-type=name&detailed=true".format(era_ip,db_entity_name)

resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers)
if resp.ok:
  print("DB_SERVER_IP={}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['databaseNodes'][0]['dbserver']['ipAddresses'][0]))
  print("DB_ID={}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['id']))
  print("DB_SERVER_ID={}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['databaseNodes'][0]['dbserverId']))
else:
  print("Get DB infor request failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
  exit(1)

# Set creds and headers
era_user = '@@{CRED_ERA.username}@@'
era_pass = '@@{CRED_ERA.secret}@@'
era_ip = '@@{ERA_IP}@@'
db_id = '@@{DB_ID}@@'

# ========= DO NOT CHANGE AFTER HERE ==========
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}

# Cleanup the DB and get Operation ID
url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/databases/{}?storage-cleanup=true&tm-cleanup=true&delete-db=false".format(era_ip,db_id)
resp = urlreq(
    url, verb="DELETE", auth="BASIC", user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers
)
if resp.ok:
    print("CLEANUP_OPERATION_ID={0}".format(json.loads(resp.content)["operationId"]))
else:
    print("Cleanup DB Operation failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
    exit(1)

# Set creds and headers
era_user = '@@{CRED_ERA.username}@@'
era_pass = '@@{CRED_ERA.secret}@@'
era_ip = '@@{ERA_IP}@@'
cleanup_operation_id = '@@{CLEANUP_OPERATION_ID}@@'

# ========= DO NOT CHANGE AFTER HERE ==========
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}

url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/operations/{}".format(era_ip,cleanup_operation_id)

# Monitor the operation
for x in range(20):

    print("Sleeping for 30 seconds.")
    sleep(30)
    resp = urlreq(
        url, verb="GET", auth="BASIC", user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers
    )
    print(
        "Percentage Complete: {}".format(
            json.loads(resp.content)["percentageComplete"]
        )
    )

    # If complete, break out of loop
    if json.loads(resp.content)["percentageComplete"] == "100":
        break

# If the operation did not complete within 10 minutes, assume it's not successful and error out
if json.loads(resp.content)["percentageComplete"] != "100":
    print("Cleanup Operation timed out", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
    exit(1)

# Set creds and headers
era_user = '@@{CRED_ERA.username}@@'
era_pass = '@@{CRED_ERA.secret}@@'
era_ip = '@@{ERA_IP}@@'
db_server_id = '@@{DB_SERVER_ID}@@'

# ========= DO NOT CHANGE AFTER HERE ==========
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}

# Cleanup the DB and get Operation ID
url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/dbservers/{}?remove=false&soft-remove=false&delete=true&delete-vm-snapshots=true&delete-vgs=true".format(era_ip,db_server_id)
resp = urlreq(
    url, verb="DELETE", auth="BASIC", user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers
)
if resp.ok:
    print("DEREGISTER_OPERATION_ID={}".format(json.loads(resp.content)["operationId"]))
else:
    print(
        "Deregister DB Server Operation failed",
        json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4),
    )
    exit(1)

# Set creds and headers
era_user = '@@{CRED_ERA.username}@@'
era_pass = '@@{CRED_ERA.secret}@@'
era_ip = '@@{ERA_IP}@@'
deregister_operation_id = '@@{DEREGISTER_OPERATION_ID}@@'

# ========= DO NOT CHANGE AFTER HERE ==========
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}


url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/operations/{}".format(era_ip,deregister_operation_id)

# Monitor the operation
for x in range(20):

    print("Sleeping for 30 seconds.")
    sleep(30)
    resp = urlreq(
        url, verb="GET", auth="BASIC", user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers
    )
    print(
        "Percentage Complete: {}".format(
            json.loads(resp.content)["percentageComplete"]
        )
    )

    # If complete, break out of loop
    if json.loads(resp.content)["percentageComplete"] == "100":
        break

# If the operation did not complete within 10 minutes, assume it's not successful and error out
if json.loads(resp.content)["percentageComplete"] != "100":
    print(
        "Deregistration Operation timed out",
        json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4),
    )
    exit(1)

attrs.script:
# Credential section
import boto3
access_key = '@@{CRED_OBJECTS.username}@@'
secret_key = '@@{CRED_OBJECTS.secret}@@'
objects_ip = "@@{OBJECTS_IP}@@"

# Variables section
objects_region = 'us-east-1'
bucket_name = '@@{BUCKET_NAME}@@'


# === DO NOT CHANGE AFTER THIS ===
my_vars = {
    's3': {
        'Bucket': bucket_name
    }
}


# Authentication
session = boto3.Session(
    aws_access_key_id=access_key,
    aws_secret_access_key=secret_key,
    region_name=objects_region
)

s3 = session.client(
    's3',
    endpoint_url='http://{}/'.format(objects_ip)
)

try:
    # Create bucket
    response = s3.create_bucket(**my_vars['s3'])
    print('Creating Objects bucket: {}'.format(
        my_vars['s3']['Bucket']))

except s3.exceptions.ClientError as error:
    raise error

attrs.script:
# Set creds and headers
era_user = '@@{CRED_ERA.username}@@'
era_pass = '@@{CRED_ERA.secret}@@'
era_ip = '@@{ERA_IP}@@'
era_cluster = '@@{ERA_CLUSTER_NAME}@@'

# ========= DO NOT CHANGE AFTER HERE ==========
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}

# Get Cluster ID
url = "https://{}/era/v0.9/clusters/name/{}".format(era_ip,era_cluster)

resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers)
if resp.ok:
  print("CLUSTER_ID={}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['id']))
else:

# Set creds and headers
era_user = '@@{CRED_ERA.username}@@'
era_pass = '@@{CRED_ERA.secret}@@'
era_ip = '@@{ERA_IP}@@'
era_sla_name = '@@{ERA_SLA_NAME}@@'
timestamp = '@@{TIMESTAMP}@@'
db_name_prefix = '@@{DB_NAME_PREFIX}@@'

# ========= DO NOT CHANGE AFTER HERE ==========
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}

# Set the db_name here, so we don't have the calm_time macro expanding at two different times
print("DB_NAME={}_{}".format(db_name_prefix,timestamp))

# Get the list of SLAs
url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/slas".format(era_ip)
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers)

# Find the desired SLA, and set the corresponding ID to the variable
if resp.ok:
  for sla in json.loads(resp.content):
    if sla['name'] == era_sla_name:
      print("SLA_ID={}".format(sla['id']))
else:
  print("Get SLA request failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
  exit(1)

# Set creds and headers
era_user = '@@{CRED_ERA.username}@@'
era_pass = '@@{CRED_ERA.secret}@@'
era_ip = '@@{ERA_IP}@@'
create_operation_id = '@@{CREATE_OPERATION_ID}@@'

# ========= DO NOT CHANGE AFTER HERE ==========
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}


url = "https://{}/era/v0.8/operations/{}".format(era_ip,create_operation_id)

# Monitor the operation
for x in range(20):
  
  print("Sleeping for 60 seconds.")
  sleep(60)
  resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', auth='BASIC', user=era_user, passwd=era_pass, headers=headers)
  print("Percentage Complete: {}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['percentageComplete']))
  
  # If complete, break out of loop
  if json.loads(resp.content)['percentageComplete'] == "100":
    break

# If the operation did not complete within 20 minutes, assume it's not successful and error out
if json.loads(resp.content)['percentageComplete'] != "100":
  print("Get Operation ID timed out", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4))
  exit(1)

# Credential section
import boto3
access_key = '@@{CRED_OBJECTS.username}@@'
secret_key = '@@{CRED_OBJECTS.secret}@@'
objects_ip = "@@{OBJECTS_IP}@@"

# Variables section
objects_region = 'us-east-1'
bucket_name = '@@{BUCKET_NAME}@@'


# === DO NOT CHANGE AFTER THIS ===
my_vars = {
    's3': {
        'Bucket': bucket_name
    }
}


# Authentication
session = boto3.Session(
    aws_access_key_id=access_key,
    aws_secret_access_key=secret_key,
    region_name=objects_region
)

s3 = session.client(
    's3',
    endpoint_url='http://{}/'.format(objects_ip)
)

try:
    # Create bucket
    response = s3.create_bucket(**my_vars['s3'])
    print('Creating Objects bucket: {}'.format(
        my_vars['s3']['Bucket']))

except s3.exceptions.ClientError as error:
    raise error
